intro: Chuquiraga erinacea var. unguis-cati, commonly known as cat's claw, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its distinctive hooked bracts that resemble cat claws, giving it its common name. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that are clustered in dense inflorescences. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often growing in rocky or sandy soils. The species is also valued for its medicinal properties, with various parts of the plant used in traditional medicine.
